Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2015 01:26AM Barb312 wrote: I haven't been on for ages because it seemed at my age I just didn't fit. Crone I remember you from bone mets thread I think. I am still hanging in there at 77. I was dx'd in Jan. 2012 with bone mets from get go. I have been on Faslodex for 16 months and doing well. Fatigue is the killer for me. I live in FL and I am able to water walk almost everyday and that has helped with feeling down more than anything. My onc. told me last week I looked like I was 62. Bless his heart . So glad i found this site.

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2012 11:48AM Barb312 wrote: Jennifer,  I was diagnosed with bone mets from the get go.  I had Taxotere and carbo also.  Also 15 rounds of radiation.  I take Zometa once a month.  I finished 6/2011.  I will have a MRI in Jan.  I have a fatigue problem and also have some pain in my back when I go to bed.  That is what I worry about the most.  I am trying to keep a positive attitude.  Did you have a rough time on Taxotere and carbo?  switched to Aromasin because of nausea on Arimidex.

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2014 08:31PM Barb312 wrote: I was on Tax/Carbo. I took this for 6 treatments and it was awful.  I changed onc's and he said he would have never given me this.  I have had stomach issues ever since. I am now on Faslodex and it is a piece of cake compared to tax/Carbo and I am doing well . It will be 3 years in a coule of weeks. Barb

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2016 03:42PM Barb312 wrote: Hi Damon, I am a few years older than you are and was dx'd almost 5 years ago from the get go with stage IV. I did alright until I started Ibrance. I have mets in bones only. My problem is fatigue and nausea. Anyone have any suggestions for an old gal that has a lot of life in her. I started Ibrance InJuly and it wasn't bad at first. This week has been a awful. Any suggestions would really be helpful. Onc. Does not want me on chemo

Posts.Content: Barb312 wrote: I have been taking Zometa for 18months and my dentist has confirmed my TMJ. I don't have pain just popping noise when I eat. It kind of comes and goes. I have read many articles on this and I worry about onj. Not sure of spelling. I am due for another infusion on Thursday and I am thinking I will take a little Z vacation. Anyone in my shoes? My jaw is a little sore. How many ladies with bone mets take Zometa? Barb Dx 1/17/2012, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Hormonal Therapy 1/24/2012 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 1/25/2012 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 1/27/2012 Bone Hormonal Therapy 10/27/2012 Aromasin (exemestane) Hormonal Therapy 1/17/2014 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2015 08:04PM Barb312 wrote: I have not had any scans for 13 months.  My markers and blood word are great and my onc. does not believe in frequent scans.  He said he will be able to tell when things are not going well, by how I feel.  I am fortunate that I have no pain.  My only complaint is stiffness in the morning.  I was diagnosed from the get go in Jan. 2012.  It has bothered me not having frequent scans, so I am happy to see that there are others like me.  Thank goodness for this site.  I don't post much, but read a lot.
